meanings.definition: A plant with sticky leaves or stems that adhere to clothing or skin.
meanings.sent1: The stickweed in the garden caught my sleeve as I walked by.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to touch the stickweed, or it will stick to you.
meanings.sent3: The stickweed seemed to play a prank on me, sticking to my shoes every time I passed.
meanings.sent4: The stickweed held onto my hand like a tiny, green octopus.
meanings.sent5: I will always remember the stickweed for its ability to cling to anything it touches.

meanings.definition: To become entangled or stuck in stickweed.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally stickweed my foot while walking through the field.
meanings.sent2: If you run through the stickweed, you might stickweed your clothes.
meanings.sent3: I stickweed myself in the stickweed patch and had to carefully untangle each leaf.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was stickweed in a web of stickweed, unable to move.
meanings.sent5: The stickweed seemed to stickweed me tighter the more I struggled to get free.
